issue.title: styled-components v6 beta feedback
issue.body: Starting a new thread for issues related to `beta` npm tag.

comment.body:
> Very excited for v6!
> 
> I’m attempting to migrate a UI library that makes use of what was named `CSSObject` in `@types/styled-components` with v5. It seems this is named `StyledObject` in v6. Is the idea to export this type from `styled-components` at some point?
> 
> **Update**:
> 
> I was able to import `StyledObject`, although importing from `dist` feels wrong (like importing internals):
> 
> ```ts
> import {StyledObject} from 'styled-components/dist/types'
> ```
> 
> The next problem I got, was that `StyledObject` ([here](https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/blob/main/packages/styled-components/src/types.ts#L218-L220)) does not allow `undefined` property values. So I get TS errors when doing things like this:
> 
> ```ts
> interface CSSObject extends StyledObject<{}> {}
> 
> function rootStyle({$shadow}): CSSObject {
>   return {
>     boxShadow: $shadow ? shadows[$shadow] : undefined
>   }
> }
> 
> const Root = styled.div(rootStyle)
> ```
> 
> TS error:
> 
> ```
> Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string | number | Dict<any> | StyledObject<{}> | StyleFunction<{}>'.
> ```

We’ll expose more types in the next release so you don’t need to reach into dist, apologies. And I’ll take a look at undefined as well

issue.title: API suggestion
issue.body:
It would be cool to ship a `zod-formik-adapter/auto` export with a getter such that it automatically wraps the first z.object() call in the adapter... allowing for more straight-forward usage:

```tsx
import {z} from 'zod-formik-adapter/auto'

const schema = z.object({})

<Formik validationSchema={schema} />
```

pull_request.title: Add option to filter commits by deploy context
pull_request.body:
I have Netlify build & deploy set up as:
- Branches:
    - Production branch: master
    - Branch deploys: Deploy all branches pushed to the repository
- Deploy Previews
    - Any pull request against your production branch / branch deploy branches

When pushing to `master`, a build is triggered on Netlify, and I have a GitHub Action that creates a tag for a new release at the same time. The next step is to wait for Netlify. The tag triggers a build with the exact same git sha as the push to `master` and without a context, `wait-for-netlify-action` is waiting for the tag branch deploy build, but it should be waiting for the `master` production build.

This PR adds a new input to the action that lets users additionally filter the searched build by the deploy context.

payload.description: Visual primitives for the component age. Use the best bits of ES6 and CSS to style your apps without stress 💅

release.name: v6.0.0-beta.5
release.body:
```
yarn add styled-components@beta
```

## What's Changed

* chore: remove extraneous lockfile by @alexandernanberg in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3848
* fix(types): react-native should not receive base web attributes by @probablyup in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3849

## Breaking changes in v6 (as of this version)

* now using `stylis` v4 (if using `stylis-plugin-rtl` you'll need to upgrade to the newer version)
* dropped `$as` and `$forwardedAs` props (use `as` or `forwardedAs`)
* dropped automatic prop filtering, use transient props (`$` prefix) for stuff you don't want to be passed to child component / HTML
* node >= 14 needed

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/compare/v6.0.0-beta.4...v6.0.0-beta.5

issue.title: Cancellation of styled components
issue.body:
For me, as a developer, the appearance of styled components was very significant. I fell in love with this library and used it on many projects, followed its development, told colleagues.

But the addition of the postinstall script by the author in version 5.3.3 offended and discredited me. I believe that open source is not for political slogans and agitations.

commits.message:
fix: don't send undefined props to DOM (#3839)

* fix: don't send undefined props to DOM

Prior to v6 this built a new object `propsForElement` with only the
forwarded props. Since v6, it changed to mutating `context` in place,
see 0b8605ab20a2c1886e4ceea7b8b7f559d820511e

The new approach keeps the props but sets them undefined. This makes
React emit errors in dev and test. Delete them from the context instead.

Additionally check and delete any undefined values in context, for
example if `.attrs()` sets some to undefined, they should be removed at
this point.

* improvement: build propsForElement instead of delete from context

This is how it used to work in v5. The earlier attempt to optimize by
modifying context directly failed because we have to delete anyway. May
as well build the new props object instead.

Additionally check and delete any undefined values in context, for example if `.attrs()` sets some to undefined, they should be removed at this point.

commits.message:
fix: various TS issues (#3828)

* fix: yarn.lock lagging release

* fix: un-exclude tests from tsc

* fix: jest discovering tests in rollup cache

* improvement: better typing for addTag

* fix: missing polymorphic props

This fixes the problem where `ZProps` is missing `as` in the example
below:

```
const Z = styled.div``
type ZProps = ComponentProps<typeof Z>
```

* fix: interpolation typing

* fix: missing custom props in createGlobalStyle

Originally from @joshjg in #3827

* fix: css tag should always return RuleSet

Originally from @garbles in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3833

* fix: add css overload without generic Props

Usually when `css` is invoked, it isn't passed a Props generic. If we
don't provide a non-generic overload, then inferred types from
interpolations can eventually conflict. Add the non-generic overload to
fix that.

Modified from @joshjg's fix in #3827

Co-authored-by: Gabe Scholz <gscholz@digitalocean.com>
Merge branch 'main' into v6/un-exclude-tests-from-tsc

Usually when `css` is invoked, it isn't passed a Props generic. If we
don't provide a non-generic overload, then inferred types from
interpolations can eventually conflict. Add the non-generic overload to
fix that.

Modified from @joshjg's fix in #3827

Co-authored-by: Gabe Scholz <gscholz@digitalocean.com>

## What's Changed

* fix(types): allow interpolating false by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3799
* Disallow mix of $as and as by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3801

## Breaking changes in v6

* now using `stylis` v4 (if using `stylis-plugin-rtl` you'll need to upgrade to the newer version)
* dropped `$as` and `$forwardedAs` props (use `as` or `forwardedAs`

* node >= 14 needed

commits.message: refactor(types): fix fltten type

refactor(types): fix attrs hole-punching

There is an edge case documented in attrs.test.tsx where a base
component may have a type that marks a particular prop as required.

Using attrs you can provide a value for this required field, in that
event we need to mark the field value in the base type as optional
since its known that a value was provided.

issue.title: feat: move style injection from render to useInsetionEffect
issue.body:
Atm this is just a quick experiment if we can utilize `useInsertionEffect` instead of injecting styles in render which isn't the best for performance. E.g. following the guidelines described in https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/110


From my limited and quick testing this seems to work fine, is there anything I'm missing and does this sound like a good idea to you? If that is the case I'll clean up the PR a little more, e.g. renaming `generateAndInjectStyles` to something more fitting

comment.body: I'll have to look at this one later. I switched us to use the new effect type for global styles but I'm not sure about doing it for component styles since they need to be injected as fast as possible on first render

issue.title: styled-components v6 beta feedback
issue.body: Starting a new thread for issues related to `beta` npm tag.

comment.body:
> Very excited for v6!
> 
> I’m attempting to migrate a UI library that makes use of what was named `CSSObject` in `@types/styled-components` with v5. It seems this is named `StyledObject` in v6. Is the idea to export this type from `styled-components` at some point?
> 
> **Update**:
> 
> I was able to import `StyledObject`, although importing from `dist` feels wrong (like importing internals):
> 
> ```ts
> import {StyledObject} from 'styled-components/dist/types'
> ```
> 
> The next problem I got, was that `StyledObject` ([here](https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/blob/main/packages/styled-components/src/types.ts#L218-L220)) does not allow `undefined` property values. So I get TS errors when doing things like this:
> 
> ```ts
> interface CSSObject extends StyledObject<{}> {}
> 
> function rootStyle({$shadow}): CSSObject {
>   return {
>     boxShadow: $shadow ? shadows[$shadow] : undefined
>   }
> }
> 
> const Root = styled.div(rootStyle)
> ```
> 
> TS error:
> 
> ```
> Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string | number | Dict<any> | StyledObject<{}> | StyleFunction<{}>'.
> ```

We’ll expose more types in the next release so you don’t need to reach into dist, apologies. And I’ll take a look at undefined as well

commits.message: Add option to filter commits by deploy context

Merge pull request #3 from dnsv/deploy-context

Add option to filter commits by deploy context

pull_request.title: Add option to filter commits by deploy context
pull_request.body:
I have Netlify build & deploy set up as:
- Branches:
    - Production branch: master
    - Branch deploys: Deploy all branches pushed to the repository
- Deploy Previews
    - Any pull request against your production branch / branch deploy branches

When pushing to `master`, a build is triggered on Netlify, and I have a GitHub Action that creates a tag for a new release at the same time. The next step is to wait for Netlify. The tag triggers a build with the exact same git sha as the push to `master` and without a context, `wait-for-netlify-action` is waiting for the tag branch deploy build, but it should be waiting for the `master` production build.

This PR adds a new input to the action that lets users additionally filter the searched build by the deploy context.

commits.message:
fix: don't send undefined props to DOM (#3839)

* fix: don't send undefined props to DOM

Prior to v6 this built a new object `propsForElement` with only the
forwarded props. Since v6, it changed to mutating `context` in place,
see 0b8605ab20a2c1886e4ceea7b8b7f559d820511e

The new approach keeps the props but sets them undefined. This makes
React emit errors in dev and test. Delete them from the context instead.

Additionally check and delete any undefined values in context, for
example if `.attrs()` sets some to undefined, they should be removed at
this point.

* improvement: build propsForElement instead of delete from context

This is how it used to work in v5. The earlier attempt to optimize by
modifying context directly failed because we have to delete anyway. May
as well build the new props object instead.

commits.message:
fix: various TS issues (#3828)

* fix: yarn.lock lagging release

* fix: un-exclude tests from tsc

* fix: jest discovering tests in rollup cache

* improvement: better typing for addTag

* fix: missing polymorphic props

This fixes the problem where `ZProps` is missing `as` in the example
below:

```
const Z = styled.div``
type ZProps = ComponentProps<typeof Z>
```

* fix: interpolation typing

* fix: missing custom props in createGlobalStyle

Originally from @joshjg in #3827

* fix: css tag should always return RuleSet

Originally from @garbles in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3833

* fix: add css overload without generic Props

Usually when `css` is invoked, it isn't passed a Props generic. If we
don't provide a non-generic overload, then inferred types from
interpolations can eventually conflict. Add the non-generic overload to
fix that.

Modified from @joshjg's fix in #3827

Co-authored-by: Gabe Scholz <gscholz@digitalocean.com>
Merge branch 'main' into v6/un-exclude-tests-from-tsc

Implement feature described in [this issue](https://github.com/Sirrine-Jonathan/storybook-source-link/issues/1). :sparkles: Test out this PR locally via: ```bash npm install storybook-source-link@2.0.1--canary.2.eaeed96.0 # or yarn add storybook-source-link@2.0.1--canary.2.eaeed96.0 ```

release.name: v6.0.0-beta.3
release.body:
```
yarn add styled-components@beta
```

## What's Changed

* fix(types): allow interpolating false by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3799
* Disallow mix of $as and as by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3801
* chore: update typescript by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3803
* fix: typescript typo by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3804
* fix: css vars mangled by hyphenateStyleName by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3812
* collected fixes for v6 typescript by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3809
* chore: correctly link local styled-components to sandbox by @alexandernanberg in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3822

## Breaking changes in v6

* now using `stylis` v4 (if using `stylis-plugin-rtl` you'll need to upgrade to the newer version)
* dropped `$as` and `$forwardedAs` props (use `as` or `forwardedAs`
* dropped automatic prop filtering, use transient props (`$` prefix) for stuff you don't want to be passed to child component / HTML
* node >= 14 needed


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/compare/v6.0.0-beta.2...v6.0.0-beta.3

commits.message: refactor(types): fix fltten type

refactor(types): fix attrs hole-punching

There is an edge case documented in attrs.test.tsx where a base
component may have a type that marks a particular prop as required.

Using attrs you can provide a value for this required field, in that
event we need to mark the field value in the base type as optional
since its known that a value was provided.

issue.title: feat: move style injection from render to useInsetionEffect
issue.body:
Atm this is just a quick experiment if we can utilize `useInsertionEffect` instead of injecting styles in render which isn't the best for performance. E.g. following the guidelines described in https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/110


From my limited and quick testing this seems to work fine, is there anything I'm missing and does this sound like a good idea to you? If that is the case I'll clean up the PR a little more, e.g. renaming `generateAndInjectStyles` to something more fitting

comment.body: I'll have to look at this one later. I switched us to use the new effect type for global styles but I'm not sure about doing it for component styles since they need to be injected as fast as possible on first render

issue.title: styled-components v6 beta feedback
issue.body: Starting a new thread for issues related to `beta` npm tag.

comment.body:
> Very excited for v6!
> 
> I’m attempting to migrate a UI library that makes use of what was named `CSSObject` in `@types/styled-components` with v5. It seems this is named `StyledObject` in v6. Is the idea to export this type from `styled-components` at some point?
> 
> **Update**:
> 
> I was able to import `StyledObject`, although importing from `dist` feels wrong (like importing internals):
> 
> ```ts
> import {StyledObject} from 'styled-components/dist/types'
> ```
> 
> The next problem I got, was that `StyledObject` ([here](https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/blob/main/packages/styled-components/src/types.ts#L218-L220)) does not allow `undefined` property values. So I get TS errors when doing things like this:
> 
> ```ts
> interface CSSObject extends StyledObject<{}> {}
> 
> function rootStyle({$shadow}): CSSObject {
>   return {
>     boxShadow: $shadow ? shadows[$shadow] : undefined
>   }
> }
> 
> const Root = styled.div(rootStyle)
> ```
> 
> TS error:
> 
> ```
> Type 'undefined' is not assignable to type 'string | number | Dict<any> | StyledObject<{}> | StyleFunction<{}>'.
> ```

We’ll expose more types in the next release so you don’t need to reach into dist, apologies. And I’ll take a look at undefined as well

commits.message: Add option to filter commits by deploy context

Merge pull request #3 from dnsv/deploy-context

Add option to filter commits by deploy context

pull_request.title: Add option to filter commits by deploy context
pull_request.body:
I have Netlify build & deploy set up as:
- Branches:
    - Production branch: master
    - Branch deploys: Deploy all branches pushed to the repository
- Deploy Previews
    - Any pull request against your production branch / branch deploy branches

When pushing to `master`, a build is triggered on Netlify, and I have a GitHub Action that creates a tag for a new release at the same time. The next step is to wait for Netlify. The tag triggers a build with the exact same git sha as the push to `master` and without a context, `wait-for-netlify-action` is waiting for the tag branch deploy build, but it should be waiting for the `master` production build.

This PR adds a new input to the action that lets users additionally filter the searched build by the deploy context.

release.body:
```
yarn add styled-components@beta
```

## What's Changed

* v6/beta 3 typescript fixes by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3828
* fix: don't send undefined props to DOM by @agriffis in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3839

* chore: add node 18 to test matrix by @alexandernanberg in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3837

## Breaking changes in v6 (as of this version)

* now using `stylis` v4 (if using `stylis-plugin-rtl` you'll need to upgrade to the newer version)
* dropped `$as` and `$forwardedAs` props (use `as` or `forwardedAs`)
* dropped automatic prop filtering, use transient props (`$` prefix) for stuff you don't want to be passed to child component / HTML
* node >= 14 needed

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/compare/v6.0.0-beta.3...v6.0.0-beta.4

commits.message:
fix: don't send undefined props to DOM (#3839)

* fix: don't send undefined props to DOM

Prior to v6 this built a new object `propsForElement` with only the
forwarded props. Since v6, it changed to mutating `context` in place,
see 0b8605ab20a2c1886e4ceea7b8b7f559d820511e

The new approach keeps the props but sets them undefined. This makes
React emit errors in dev and test. Delete them from the context instead.

Additionally check and delete any undefined values in context, for
example if `.attrs()` sets some to undefined, they should be removed at
this point.

* improvement: build propsForElement instead of delete from context

This is how it used to work in v5. The earlier attempt to optimize by
modifying context directly failed because we have to delete anyway. May
as well build the new props object instead.

The new approach keeps the props but sets them undefined. This makes React emit errors in dev and test. Delete them from the context instead.

commits.message:
fix: various TS issues (#3828)

* fix: yarn.lock lagging release

* fix: un-exclude tests from tsc

* fix: jest discovering tests in rollup cache

* improvement: better typing for addTag

* fix: missing polymorphic props

This fixes the problem where `ZProps` is missing `as` in the example
below:

```
const Z = styled.div``
type ZProps = ComponentProps<typeof Z>
```

* fix: interpolation typing

* fix: missing custom props in createGlobalStyle

Originally from @joshjg in #3827

* fix: css tag should always return RuleSet

Originally from @garbles in https://github.com/styled-components/styled-components/pull/3833

* fix: add css overload without generic Props

Usually when `css` is invoked, it isn't passed a Props generic. If we
don't provide a non-generic overload, then inferred types from
interpolations can eventually conflict. Add the non-generic overload to
fix that.

Modified from @joshjg's fix in #3827

Co-authored-by: Gabe Scholz <gscholz@digitalocean.com>
Merge branch 'main' into v6/un-exclude-tests-from-tsc

:sparkles: Test out this PR locally via: ```bash npm install storybook-source-link@2.0.1--canary.2.eaeed96.0 # or yarn add storybook-source-link@2.0.1--canary.2.eaeed96.0 ```

> TS error trying to destructure theme from props, see X and Y in sandbox

It's actually the use of `css` ttl that it's complaining about, if you reduce it to a simple interpolation it works:

```
const X = styled.h1`
  color: ${({ theme }) => theme.colors.red};
`
```

I'll take a look at the `Interpolation` type and see if something needs to be done...

> Styled component props seems to lack as, hover over ZProps in same sandbox

Interesting, if you compose Z as jsx it takes and resolves the `as` just fine. Will look into it.

## What's Changed

* node >= 14 needed

commits.message: refactor(types): fix fltten type

refactor(types): fix attrs hole-punching

There is an edge case documented in attrs.test.tsx where a base
component may have a type that marks a particular prop as required.

Using attrs you can provide a value for this required field, in that
event we need to mark the field value in the base type as optional
since its known that a value was provided.

issue.title: feat: move style injection from render to useInsetionEffect
issue.body:
Atm this is just a quick experiment if we can utilize `useInsertionEffect` instead of injecting styles in render which isn't the best for performance. E.g. following the guidelines described in https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/110


From my limited and quick testing this seems to work fine, is there anything I'm missing and does this sound like a good idea to you? If that is the case I'll clean up the PR a little more, e.g. renaming `generateAndInjectStyles` to something more fitting

comment.body: I'll have to look at this one later. I switched us to use the new effect type for global styles but I'm not sure about doing it for component styles since they need to be injected as fast as possible on first render
